body.p: The function Re-Import document allows to re-import a document from within the editor in case the source file is changed frequently. This avoids to manually process each single document re-import step.

Basic Information:
The function only works for documents which have been imported on the machine from which the reload function is started. If the document has been imported using a folder import or a document import in internal format, the function will not be available. The function will also not be available when the original document is not accessible - e.g. it resides on a network drive which is not available at this time or the external document has been deleted.
The document re-import will not overwrite the original document properties, only the document time stamps and the completion rate will be adjusted.
The analysis step will use the analysis options which were active at the time where the last analysis was executed on the folder containing the document. To ensure that no translation work is lost the Automatic substitution option is generally used even when the option was not active during the last manual analysis run.
When the newly re-imported and re-analyzed document is opened in the translation editor, the segment which was active at the time the re-import function was started will be made the active one. It may happen that the segmentation is slightly different due to the changed document source file and that the activated segment is not the correct one.
A key-combination can be assigned to the re-import document function. This is performed via Options, Keys, panel Assign Keys, function Re-import document.
The process to re-import a document while being in the translation editor is started by going to File, Re-Import document.

This starts the following process:
Close the translation editor.
Import the document.
Analyze the document with the previously used analysis settings.
Open the analyzed document in the translation editor.
Position the cursor in the segment which was active when the Re-Import process was started.
See also the folder properties window on page .
